TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
43 [George]
SEint George þe holie man : ase we findez i-write,
In þe londe of Cappadoce : he was i-bore and bi-&yogh;ite.
þe false godes he for-sok : and tornede to cristine-dom,
And louede Iesu crist swiþe wel : and holi man bi-com.
Dacian, þe luþere prince : þat was in þulke stounde,
Alle þe cristine men þat he fond : he let bringue to grounde.
A day, ase he honourede is false godes : and oþere manie on,
Seint George I-sai&yogh; al þis : ase he cam þare-forth gon.
þe signe he made of þe croiz : and blessede him al-a-boute
And Armede him þoru&yogh; þe holie gost : with-Inne and with-oute,
he wende him forth wel baldeliche : and wel loude bi-gan to grede
To Dacian and to Alle his : and þeose wordes sede :
"Alle false godes so beoth : deuelschine, i-wis;
For ore louerd made heuene : ase in þe sautere i-writen it is."
þo Dacian i-heorde þis : he grennede and femde faste,
And lourede with sori semblaunt : and þeos wordes out he caste :
"Belamy, &yogh;wat art þou : þat so gret fol art and so bold,
þat in ovre power and bi ovre godes : swuche wordes hast i-told?
þov ne dost us nou&yogh;t one schame : ase we alle I-seoth,
Ake ore godes and us, &yogh;wane þou seist : þat huy deuelene beoth.
Tel me sone of &yogh;wannes þou art : and &yogh;wat is þi ri&yogh;te name,
þat darst us segge and ore godes : þus baldeliche swch[MS. schwch] schame."
"George, ich hote," þis oþur seide : "and cristine man ich am,
And out of þe lond of cappadoce : hidere to eov ich cam."
"bel amy," seide Dacian : "torne þi word a-non
And honoure here ovre godes : oþur it schal an-oþur gon."
"Beo stille, þov fol," seint George seide : "þou spext embe nou&yogh;t,
For ich habbe on Iesu crist : I-fastned al mi þou&yogh;t."
"A, traytour," seide Dacian : "wolt þov take on so?
þov schalt in oþere ribaudies : sone dai&yogh;es beo i-do."
he liet him hangi up an hei&yogh; : In one-manere rode
And þare-to him binde faste al naked : with ropes strongue and guode.
with kene Owles þer-under : þe tormentores stode
And to-drowen is holie lymes : þat faste huy ronne on blode;
Al huy to-teren is te[n]dre flesch : þe peces fullen to grounde;
Brenninde eoyle huy nomen sethþe : and casten In þe wounde.
þo huy hadden him so longue to-drawe : þat reouþe it was to seo,
huy bi-þou&yogh;ten heom of more wo : and nomen him a-doun of þe treo :
with smarte scourges huy leiden on him : and wounde op-on oþur madeâ€”
to þe bare bon þe scourgene comen : ase þe Owles hadden i-wade;
þe woundene huy selten sethþe : and salt ful þicke caste,
And sethþe with a clout of here : roddeden þe woundes faste.
louerd, muche was þe pine þat he hadde : ech ope oþur þere,
þo men selten so is quike flesch : and roddeden so with here!
Reuþe it was swuch pine to se : ho-so ou&yogh;t of reuþe were;
And euere lay þe guode Man : ase þei him noþing nere.
¶ þo Dacian i-sai&yogh; þat he ne mi&yogh;te : ouer-comen him so,
he let binde þene holie man : and in strongue prisone do.
þare he lai al þe longue ni&yogh;t : to oþur wo þat he hadde.
A-morewe þe tormentores eft-sone : bi-fore Daciane him ladden.
In eche manere huy fondeden þo : &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;ten tuyrne is þou&yogh;t.
Ake þo huy i-sei&yogh;en euerech-one : þat it was al for nou&yogh;t,
Dacian let makie a weol of bras : so strong ase he mi&yogh;te,
And scharpe sweordes wel þicke a-boute : þare-on faste he pi&yogh;te :
he let nime þis holie man : and þare-aboue him do,
þat þe swerdes scholden is bodi to-rende : and to-drawe al-so.
So sone ase huy þis guode man : a-boue þusse &yogh;weole brou&yogh;te,
þat &yogh;weol to-brac, ase god it wolde : and to-bruysde al-to nou&yogh;te;
So þat þis holie man : harmles þarof he was.
Dacian was swiþe wroth : þo he i-sai&yogh; þat cas.
¶ A forneis he let maken[al. nyme] of bras : and fullen it ful of led;
he let maken a strong fuyr i-nov&yogh; : ase he nam sone is red.
Þo þat led was al i-molte : and boylede swiþe faste,
he let nimen þis holie man : and ri&yogh;t a-middes caste.
SEint George nam up is hond : and þe croiz bi-fore him made,
And in þe wallinde led : baldeliche he gan wade.
þare-Inne he sat wel softe a-doun : ase þei him noþing nere,
And leonede to þe brerde stille : ase þei he a-slepe were;
he lai ase þei he in reste were : for-to þat led atþe laste
was al in-to þe colde i-turnd : þat boylede er so faste.
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te : ase men mi&yogh;ten þare i-seo,
þat ani man mi&yogh;te in þe wallinde led : so longue harmles beo!
¶ þo Dacian þis i-sei&yogh; : his wit him was nei&yogh; bi-nome;
"Mahun," he seide, "hov geth þis? : &yogh;ware is novþe þi mi&yogh;te bi-come?
&YOGH;wane I-ne may þis foule þeof : ouer-come in þusse wise,
I schal bi-nime him sone is lijf : þare he ne schal neuere a-rise."
his dom he gan to &yogh;iue a-non : þat huy seint George nome
And drowen him þoru&yogh;-ovt[out superscribed.] al þe toun : for-to-huy with-oute come,
[& þat][om. in the MS.] huy smiten of his heued : with-oute þe toun atþe laste,
And is bodi þare in sum foul place : to wilde bestes it caste.
Þo þis dom was þus I&yogh;yue : hit nas nou&yogh;t i-lete :
huy nomen and drowen þis holie man : villiche þoru&yogh; þe strete,
Forto huy comen with-oute toun : þare huy wolden is heued of smite.
heore wepne huy drowen forth and &yogh;wetten hem : kene forto bite.
"Leoue breþren," seint George seide : "one stounde a-bidez &yogh;uyte,
For-to ich habbe to Iesu crist : mine bone i-bede a luyte."
¶ his hondene he heold up on hei&yogh; : a-doun he sat on kneo,
And seide, "swete louerd Iesu crist : þat alle þing mi&yogh;t i-seo,
graunte me, &yogh;if þi wille is : þat, ho-so in guode manere
halewez mine day in Aueril : for mi loue on eorþe here,
þat þare ne falle in þat hous : no qualm in al þe &yogh;ere,
Ne gret sijknesse ne hongur strong : þat þarof beo no fere;
And ho-so in perile of þe se : to me bit is bone,
Oþur in any oþur stude perilous : louerd, þov helpe heom sone!"
¶ þo i-heorden huy a voiz in heuene : þat to him seide, i-wis :
"Mi blessede child, cum here forth to me : þi bone i-heord is."
þo is heued was of i-smite : ase al þat folk i-sei&yogh;,
Aungles nomen is swete soule : and to heuene beren on hei&yogh;.
þare he is in grete Ioye : þat last with-outen ende.
Nov god for seint Georges loue : late ore soule þudere wende.
